title: FOIA Request for Body Cam Footage Related to the Death of Daunte Wright

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Here's an updated version of the FOIA request, specifically focused on obtaining body cam footage:

FOIA Request for Body Cam Footage Related to the Death of Daunte Wright

Date: September 17, 2024

To:
Hennepin County Sheriff’s Office
Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Officer
350 South Fifth Street, Room 6
Minneapolis, MN 55415

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request – Body Cam Footage in Daunte Wright Case

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (MGDPA) and other applicable statutes or regulations, I am requesting access to body cam footage and any related records associated with the incident involving former Brooklyn Center police officer Kimberly Potter and Daunte Wright, which occurred on April 11, 2021.

Specifically, I am requesting the following:

All body cam footage recorded by Officer Kimberly Potter and any other officers present at the scene during the traffic stop and subsequent shooting of Daunte Wright.

Any accompanying audio or video footage from police vehicles (dash cams), or other law enforcement equipment during this incident.

Documents or reports detailing the chain of custody, storage, and preservation of the body cam footage related to this incident.

Any transcripts or logs related to the review or use of the body cam footage in the investigation or trial preparation for this case.

If possible, I would prefer to receive these records electronically at [Your Email Address]. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me in advance.

I look forward to your response within the timeframe required by law. If this request should be directed to another agency or department, please let me know.

Thank you for your time and assistance in processing this request.

Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Greg Robinson
